description.para: Evaluates an expression and, when the result is FALSE, prints a diagnostic message and sets the kernel to debug mode.

param_note.para: Expression (including pointers) that evaluates to nonzero or 0.

remarks.para: The assert macro is used to identify logical errors during program development by implementing the expression argument to evaluate to false, only when the program is not operating properly.

In DEBUG and RELEASE versions, assert prints a diagnostic message when expression evaluates to false (0) and sets the kernel to debug mode. No action is taken if expression is true (nonzero). The diagnostic message includes the failed expression and the name of the source file and line number where the assertion failed.
Assert checking is turned off in NAKED version.
